column1: evidence arising from the intrinsic evidence of the contents or by presumptions.”
Moreover, Section 68 of Partition Act states thus

column2: “It  shall  not  be  necessary  in  any  proceedings  under  this  Law  to  adduce
formal proof of the execution of any deed which, on the face of it, purports

column1: to  have  been  duly  executed,  unless

column2: impeached by a party claiming adversely to the party producing that deed,

column1: or unless the court requires such proof.”
